resources.string: What\'s the name of this place (hint: it\'s in Peru)?
Who discovered this ancient city in 1911?
What job did the discoverer of this city hold?
What is the name of a tribe whose symbol depicted below that inhabited this land?
What was the official language of this tribe?
What was the purpose of that ancient city?
This picture was taken in Machu Picchu.

Machu Picchu was unknown to the modern world until 1911, when Hiram Bingham, a Yale history professor, stumbled across its grass-covered terraces and tumbledown walls. The lost city has been almost entirely excavated and reconstructed.
During his lifetime, Hiram Bingham was a Yale professor, military pilot, governor of Connecticut, and U.S. senator. But he will always be remembered as the man who uncovered Machu Picchu.
Depicted Chakana â€” ancient Inca Empire symbol.

To enable the hundreds of ethnic officials across the empire to communicate, the Inca made their native tongue, Quechua, the state language. But no words were ever recorded. The Inca, like all Andean peoples, lacked a system of writing.

In 1531, Francisco Pizarro, an illiterate Spanish soldier, set sail with 180 men and 37 horses to conquer Peru for its gold. The total subjugation of Peru was accomplished in 1572 and most of the Inca\'s gold and silver treasures had been found and melted down.

Recent research indicates that rather than being a defensive stronghold, Machu Picchu was a retreat built by and for the Inca ruler Pachacutec. Others have suggested it was built for elites wanting to escape the noise and congestion of the city.
